resources.string:
This android application for the Muse Headband was created with the intention of improving concentration.


However, unlike the original Muse application (developed by Interaxon), this application will be utlizing brain wave activity in a slightly different way. 

Studies have shown that tasks requiring intense, directed focus (reading, studying, etc...) require different brain wave distribution when compared with meditation or sleep, for example.


More specifically, these focus-driven tasks require a combination of low alpha-wave activity, and high beta-wave activity.


After a quick test to establish baseline brainwave levels, the user will be alerted when alpha or beta wave activity rises too high or falls too low during their task.


This 3rd party application was developed by Zachary Michael McGinnis, 2016 

The Muse headband and Muse meditation application are property of InteraXon Labs.
Muse needs a few permissions to work properly. On the next screens, tap "Allow" to proceed. If you deny, Muse will not work properly until you go into your Android settings and allow.
